Package io.wcm.caconfig.editor

Interface ConfigurationCategoryProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    io.wcm.sling.commons.caservice.ContextAwareService
    @ConsumerType
public interface ConfigurationCategoryProvider
extends io.wcm.sling.commons.caservice.ContextAwareService
    Provides metadata for configuration categories used by an application.

    Applications can set service properties or bundle headers as defined in ContextAwareService to apply this configuration only for resources that match the relevant resource paths.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface io.wcm.sling.commons.caservice.ContextAwareService

        PROPERTY_ACCEPTS_CONTEXT_PATH_EMPTY, PROPERTY_CONTEXT_PATH_BLACKLIST_PATTERN, PROPERTY_CONTEXT_PATH_PATTERN

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      @Nullable java.lang.String getCategory​(@NotNull org.apache.sling.caconfig.spi.metadata.ConfigurationMetadata configurationMetadata)
      This method is called for configurations that are in use and do not have a category name assigned.
      @Nullable ConfigurationCategory getCategoryMetadata​(@NotNull java.lang.String category)

    • Method Detail

      • getCategoryMetadata

        @Nullable
@Nullable ConfigurationCategory getCategoryMetadata​(@NotNull
                                                    @NotNull java.lang.String category)
        Get metadata for a given configuration name.
        Parameters:
        category - Category name
        Returns:
        Metadata or null if category is not known

      • getCategory

        @Nullable
@Nullable java.lang.String getCategory​(@NotNull
                                       @NotNull org.apache.sling.caconfig.spi.metadata.ConfigurationMetadata configurationMetadata)
        This method is called for configurations that are in use and do not have a category name assigned. With this method it's possible to assign categories by inspecting the configuration metadata, or to just assign a default category.
        Parameters:
        configurationMetadata - Metadata of configuration that does not have a category defined
        Returns:
        Category name or null if no category should be assigned
